...UPPER MIDWEST/OH VALLEY/CNTRL APPALACHIAN MTNS...
   A POSITIVELY-TILTED UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS FORECAST TO MOVE SEWD FROM
   THE NRN PLAINS INTO THE UPPER MS VALLEY ON MONDAY. AT THE SFC...A
   MOIST AXIS SHOULD BE IN PLACE FROM THE LOWER OH VALLEY NWD INTO THE
   UPPER MS VALLEY...ALONG WHICH MODERATE INSTABILITY SHOULD DEVELOP BY
   MIDDAY. A COUPLE CLUSTERS OF THUNDERSTORMS COULD BE ONGOING MONDAY
   MORNING ALONG A GRADIENT OF INSTABILITY FROM ERN WI SSEWD ACROSS
   LAKE MI INTO IND WHERE AN ISOLATED WIND DAMAGE THREAT WILL BE
   POSSIBLE. AS SFC TEMPS WARM...AN AXIS OF STRONG INSTABILITY IS
   FORECAST TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE MID-MS VALLEY AND LOWER OH VALLEY
   EXTENDING NWD INTO WI. SFC-BASED THUNDERSTORMS APPEAR MOST LIKELY TO
   INITIATE AT THE NRN END OF THE STRONGEST INSTABILITY ACROSS SRN WI
   DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON. THIS CONVECTION IS FORECAST TO EXPAND IN
   COVERAGE AND RAPIDLY INTENSIFY...MOVING SSEWD ACROSS THE CHICAGO
   METRO EVENTUALLY REACHING INDIANAPOLIS IND DURING THE EVENING. *DUE
   TO STRONG INSTABILITY AND FAVORABLE DEEP-LAYER SHEAR PROFILES...A
   SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER EVENT SEEMS PROBABLE FROM NERN IL SSEWD
   ACROSS IND INTO NRN KY FROM LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THE
   EVENING.*
